SrRuO3 thin films are synthesized via PLD, showing ferromagnetic properties and a Curie temperature of ~128 K. The films exhibit metallic characteristics, with significant Ti-Ru intermixing in the first SrRuO3 block, leading to a metallic behavior and reduced Ru content.

Overall, stoichiometric SrRuO3 films show better magnetic behavior compared to non-stoichiometric ones. The prepared SrRuO3 samples on different substrates exhibit varying degrees of magnetic order and properties due to interfacial effects and sample thickness.
